org.zoolu.tools

Class Timer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.zoolu.tools.Timer

  • public class Timer
extends java.lang.Object
    A Timer is a simple object that fires an onTimeout() method to its TimerListener when the time expires. A Timer have to be started and can be halted before expired.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean SINGLE_THREAD
      Whether using single thread for all timer instances.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Timer(long t_msec, java.lang.String t_label, TimerListener t_listener)
      Creates a new Timer of msec milliseconds, with a label t_event, and with TimerListener listener The Timer is not started.
      Timer(long t_msec, TimerListener t_listener)
      Creates a new Timer of msec milliseconds with TimerListener listener The Timer is not started.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getLabel()
      Gets the Timer label.
      long getTime()
      Gets the initial time (in milliseconds).
      void halt()
      Stops the Timer.
      void onInnerTimeout()
      When the Timeout fires
      void start()
      Starts the timer

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • SINGLE_THREAD

        public static boolean SINGLE_THREAD
        Whether using single thread for all timer instances.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Timer

        public Timer(long t_msec,
     TimerListener t_listener)
        Creates a new Timer of msec milliseconds with TimerListener listener The Timer is not started. You need to fire the start() method.

      • Timer

        public Timer(long t_msec,
     java.lang.String t_label,
     TimerListener t_listener)
        Creates a new Timer of msec milliseconds, with a label t_event, and with TimerListener listener The Timer is not started. You need to fire the start() method.

    • Method Detail

      • getLabel

        public java.lang.String getLabel()
        Gets the Timer label.

      • getTime

        public long getTime()
        Gets the initial time (in milliseconds).

      • halt

        public void halt()
        Stops the Timer. The onTimeout() method will not be fired.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the timer

      • onInnerTimeout

        public void onInnerTimeout()
        When the Timeout fires
